36.description: Remaining imprisoned Pussy Riot members transferred to camps  Two members of the anti-Putin band Pussy Riot have been sent to remote prison colonies to serve their sentences for hooliganism, according to supporters of the group.

37.description: Russia's jailed Pussy Riot members sent to prison camps

38.description: Russia's jailed Pussy Riot members sent to prison camps  Two female members of Russian punk group Pussy Riot convicted of protesting against President Vladimir Putin in a cathedral have been sent to prisons far from Moscow despite requesting to serve out their terms in the capital, a lawyer said on Monday.

81.description: Two Members of Pussy Riot Sent to Siberian Prison Camps

82.description: Two Members of Pussy Riot Sent to Siberian Prison Camps  Almost two weeks after the release of Yekaterina Samutsevich, the two remaining jailed members of Pussy Riot have been shipped to prison camps in Siberia, The Washington Post reported. Nadya Tolokonnivoka and Maria Aloykhina were sent to separate camps on Saturday after leaving prison in Moscow. Tolokonnikova was sent to a camp in Mordovia and Aloyhnia to Perm. The camps are known as being some of the roughest in the region and house political and dangerous criminals. Tolokonnivoka and Aloykhina face two years in the labor camps after the ruling was upheld earlier this month.
